comments.author: mark@marktrompell.de
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030624 Mozilla Firebird/0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030624 Mozilla Firebird/0.6

after installing jre1.3.1, the following error occured:
LoadPlugin: failed to initialize shared library
/usr/local/MozillaFirebird/plugins/java2/plugin/i386/ns600/libjavaplugin_oji.so
[/usr/local/MozillaFirebird/plugins/java2/plugin/i386/ns600/libjavaplugin_oji.so:
undefined symbol: __vt_17nsGetServiceByCID

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Install Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition Version 1.3.1
2.restart firebird
3.

Actual Results:  
no java-plugin available

Expected Results:  
working perfect

Installed Browser:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030624 Mozilla Firebird/0.6
comments.creator: mark@marktrompell.de

comments.author: charlesb@winfield.net
comments.raw_text:
Had no problem with java plugin till this rc3 release.
(Apart from the need to make a symbolic link in mozilla 
plugin directory rather than copying the .so file).

Using RedHat 8.0 on AMD 1800+ 512 Mb lots of disk
comments.creator: charlesb@winfield.net
comments.text:
Created attachment 126531
error on opening mozilla rc3 candidate

Had no problem with java plugin till this rc3 release.
(Apart from the need to make a symbolic link in mozilla 
plugin directory rather than copying the .so file).

Using RedHat 8.0 on AMD 1800+ 512 Mb lots of disk

comments.author: mark@marktrompell.de
comments.raw_text:
Sorry, this was not a bug this was my stupidity. It works with j2re-1.4.2b
gcc-3.2-version.
